entry.title: SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop 'Integrated Toolchain' (Virtual, November 19, 2025)
entry.content:
Virtual

November 19, 2025

Agenda

Dear Valued Customers,

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop “Integrated Toolchain” taking place virtually on 19th November 2025.  Please find the agenda of workshop here.

With the introduction of the RISE with SAP methodology, the Integrated Tool Chain and related transformation tools and services have become key enablers within the SAP Cloud ERP portfolio.  The Integrated Tool Chain is designed to orchestrate every phase of a business and IT transformation—bringing together the strengths of SAP Signavio, SAP LeanIX, SAP Cloud ALM, and SAP WalkMe into a seamless end-to-end journey. Built on a collaborative methodology, it ensures alignment between business and IT stakeholders—enabling organizations to realize value faster, from the initial discovery phase through to continuous improvement after go-live. During this workshop, we will explore the capabilities of these tools and showcase a live demo illustrating how SAP’s Integrated Tool Chain helps define, map, and execute transformation activities ultimately accelerating the customer’s transformation journey.

Our Workshops

These sessions and workshop series focus on a specific topic and the purpose is to enable our customers to understand the product portfolio and innovative technologies of SAP in order to drive adoption and consumption. As specifically now, it is more important than ever to help companies to be successful and to respond to changing markets by transforming into intelligent enterprises in the experience economy.

Important

Please note that the 'Attend' button which can be found within this blog post does not serve as a formal registration for the event.

To officially register, please reach out to me, paul.schropp@sap.com and I will ensure that your registration is properly processed.

We look forward to having you join us for our upcoming events and thank you for your understanding!

Your feedback

Feel free to share your feedback and thoughts in the comment section below.

entry.title: "Analyze Stock Over Time" app
entry.content:
I am currently working with a client who has been using SAP since 2018. In their current SAP ERP system, they have enhanced the MB5B - Stock on Posting Date transaction by adding the field “G/L Account” as a filter criterion.

Now, the client is migrating to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition (release 2508) and plans to use the “Analyze Stock in Date Range” application. However, this app does not currently provide the option to include the “G/L Account” field as a filter.

Therefore, I would like to know how it would be possible to achieve the same functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition — that is, to have the ability to filter by G/L Account, ensuring continuity of the reporting capabilities currently available in MB5B.

Thank you in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Supply Chain Planning Reimagined: Charting the Path to Decision-Centric, Autonomous Planning
entry.content:
For decades, supply chain leaders have been on a relentless quest for greater efficiency. We've built global networks, mastered lean inventory, and embraced automation at breakneck speeds. But the last few years have upended comfortable certainties. Geopolitical upheaval, pandemic ripple effects, and climate-related disruptions have rewritten the rules—turning volatility into the new normal. Today, planning is no longer a periodic exercise; it’s a dynamic, always-on process at the heart of business resilience and agility.

To empower confident and resilient planning companies need to synchronize decision-making across end-to-end supply chains, and drive sustainable value through data science, AI-powered insights, and transformative, outcomes-centric processes.

The Challenge: Confronting Complexity and Persistent Change

Supply chain leaders face an environment defined by persistent uncertainty. Plans must change not by quarter or by month—but sometimes by hour. Yet too many organizations are still hampered by legacy silos and fragmented tools, resulting in disjointed planning, slow decision cycles, and out-of-date data. The pressure to keep peace and indeed to anticipate disruption has never been greater.

The journey from data to action is often bogged down in manual handoffs, conflicting KPIs, and limited scenario planning, limiting the impact of even the best talent and intentions.

The Vision: Decision-Centric, Autonomous Planning

The future belongs to forward-thinking leaders who embrace a new model: decision-centric, autonomous supply chain planning.

But what does this mean in practice?

  • Integrated Decision-Centric Planning to achieve resilient and optimized mid to long-range plans with an AI-powered planning platform. This enables companies to seamlessly collaborate across supply chain, commercial, and finance teams to deliver financially smart scenario plans and adapt to market shifts with confidence.
  • Autonomous Planning and Decision Making by accelerating operational agility across the business network to enhance decision-making across the entire supply chain.
  • Post Planning Decision Intelligence and Actioning to enable cross-functional planning and real-time decisions by tracking plan-to-execution against KPIs, and enabling continuous corrective actions for enhanced agility across your value chain.
  • Convergence of supply chain silos by Integrating real-time data, synchronizing production and scheduling, and collaborating across the network to enhance agility, optimize resources, and improve customer satisfaction.
  • Unified Planner Experience through streamlined planning views for supply chain leaders and decision makers.
  • Put people at the Center to enable a human-centric supply chain that transforms your operations by autonomously executing routine tasks to free up people to focus on high-value activities.

    By connecting these capabilities, companies can create a unified workspace designed with planners in mind to anticipating risk, managing by exception, and relentlessly driving better outcomes.

    Delivering Tangible Value: The Autonomous Advantage

    What does this look like in measurable business impact?

    SAP’s advanced planning platform is driving real results for companies worldwide:

    • Up to 24% improved forecast accuracy and up to 82% lower revenue loss due to stockouts by unifying data and automating demand sensing.
    • 4–20% improvement in on-time, in-full delivery, boosting customer satisfaction and loyalty.
    • Optimized working capital through smarter inventory placement and risk-aware scenario planning.
    • Faster planning cycles so that teams that once updated plans weekly can now adapt in near real-time, reallocating resources in minutes rather than days.
    • Actionable alerts and “guided” user experiences allowing supply chain teams to focus on the deviations that matter, rather than drowning in data noise.

      Critically, this approach enables organizations not just to react faster, but to leap ahead, and to turn their supply chain from a cost center into a competitive differentiator.

      Cultivating a Culture of Continuous Improvement

      Adopting decision-centric, autonomous planning is more than a technology upgrade. It requires a fundamental shift in mindset: from reactive firefighting to proactive, empowered problem-solving.

      The most successful teams are those that embrace change, foster collaboration, and encourage learning at every level.

      At SAP, we strive to be a trusted partner on this journey, providing not just technology, but proven business templates, industry best practices, and a collaborative ecosystem. Our mission is to help planners and decision-makers become architects of resilience and agents of innovation in their organizations.

      Charting the Path Forward

      In today’s landscape, the only constant is change, and the urgency for more agile, intelligent supply chains is undeniable. The winners of tomorrow will be those who act today to unlock new levels of confidence, speed, and value creation through decision-centric, autonomous planning.

      Whether you’re a seasoned supply chain executive or rising operations leader, now is the time to ask:

      • Are your planning processes set up not just for efficiency, but for resilience and continuous transformation?
      • Are your teams empowered to make decisions at the speed of business—or held back by legacy limitations?

        At SAP, our promise is to help you reimagine what supply chain planning can achieve: empowering your talent, unleashing innovation, and turning complexity into your greatest advantage.

        To learn more, listen to a recent Future of Supply Chain podcast with SAP Supply Chain Planning, Chief Product Officer SP van Houten - Episode 131: Supply Chain Planning Re-imagined with SAP’s SP van Houten

entry.title: Question about using an existing DIAN digital certificate for integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Pub
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently configuring the integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and the DIAN (Colombia) through SAP Document and Report Compliance (DRC).

Our client's company already has a digital certificate issued by the DIAN, which is still valid for two years. However, this certificate is currently being used and linked to our legacy ERP system (SIESA).

Our question is:
👉 Do we need to request a new digital certificate to establish the communication between SAP DRC and the DIAN, or is it possible to reuse the existing valid certificate, considering that it was issued for the same company and NIT?

We would really appreciate any guidance or shared experiences from those who have gone through this process, especially regarding the technical implications or limitations of reusing an existing DIAN certificate in a new SAP environment.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights.

        const serviceUri = this.getOwnerComponent()!.getManifestEntry("/sap.app/dataSources").mainService.uri;
        console.log("serviceUri: " + serviceUri);

        const localAnnotationUrl = sap.ui.require.toUrl("dummy3/annotations/annotation0.xml");

entry.title: A Story of Innovation - From Local Beginnings to Global Intelligence with AI-Assisted Insights
entry.content:
How SAP’s Global Business Partner Certificate Management Solution Transforms Compliance

Across industries and regions, businesses face a common challenge — managing partner certificates efficiently while meeting strict regulatory requirements.

Different countries enforce unique rules, formats, and audit practices, making it difficult for organizations to stay compliant while operating globally.

Recognizing this growing complexity, SAP teams set out to transform certificate management from a manual, country-specific task into a unified, intelligent global process — leading to the creation of the Global Business Partner Certificate Management solution.

A New Chapter for SAP Customers and Partners

This week, SAP hosted a global webinar to introduce this innovation to customers and partners worldwide.
The session brought together SAP experts and business leaders from multiple regions to explore how this new capability helps organizations ensure compliance, simplify operations, and harness AI for smarter insights.

The Business Partner Certificate Management solution empowers SAP S/4HANA customers to centrally maintain and monitor certificates for both suppliers and customers, addressing the end-to-end lifecycle of compliance documentation.

The goal is simple — make compliance intelligent, reducing risk and manual effort while enabling businesses to operate seamlessly across borders.

From Regional Beginnings to Global Availability

The journey began with the Supplier Certificate Management solution, first introduced in selected countries across the MENA region and India to manage supplier legal certificates.

Encouraged by strong adoption, customers soon asked a pivotal question:

That feedback sparked a transformation. SAP extended the concept to cover both suppliers and customers, delivering a more comprehensive Business Partner Certificate Management solution that is now available globally across SAP S/4HANA (On-Premise and Private Cloud Edition) — with expansion to Public Cloud on the horizon.

Unifying Compliance with Intelligence

The new solution provides a centralized, structured, and auditable way to manage certificates directly within the Business Partner master data.

It supports full lifecycle management — including exemptions, extensions, renewals, restorations, and deletions — all within SAP S/4HANA.
This ensures that every business partner record remains compliant, current, and ready for audit.

Empowered by SAP Joule

To make the experience even smarter, the solution now integrates with SAP Joule, the AI copilot that delivers AI-assisted insights into certificate management.

Co-Innovation and Customer Feedback

The webinar also showcased real-world use cases — from managing trade licenses in the UAE to maintaining minority certificates in the United States — and included open dialogue with customers on topics such as Fiori integration, document uploads, tax exemptions, and automation opportunities.

SAP experts emphasized that customer input continues to guide the roadmap — with planned enhancements such as automated data extraction from PDFs, email notifications, and deeper integration with SAP Master Data Governance (MDG).

Looking Ahead

The Global Business Partner Certificate Management solution marks a milestone in SAP’s mission to help organizations run compliantly, intelligently, and globally.

By combining automation, AI, and business process integration, SAP is enabling customers to transform certificate management from an operational necessity into a strategic capability — one that supports resilience, transparency, and trust across every business partnership.

As one participant summarized it perfectly:

“This is not just a feature — it’s a foundation for smarter, compliant business partnerships worldwide.....

Learn more:
Stay tuned to SAP Community for upcoming feature spotlights, customer success stories, and implementation guidance for the Business Partner Certificate Management solution.

Documentation - SAP Help

Blog post - SAP Community

Note 3584385 - SAP for me

Event Page - teams.microsoft

entry.title: Copy of Printout from SAP Going to Wrong Label Printer (Different Plant) when producing material
entry.content:
Hello, 

So i have a very strange problem and will explain the setup below.. 

Plant 1 has 3x Printers and 3x Computers , PC/Printer 1, PC/Printer 2, PC/Printer 3
They all share the same login details User login = User1 for all 3 computers. 

Each printer in Plant 1 has its own IP.
Host Printer = pr1 (not sure what this means?) Group? 
Destination Host = individual IP for each printer

Each material produced has its own setup, different packaging materials, instructions etc... 


Our SAP is setup for multiple plants. 
Plant 1 (my plant)
Plant 2 (receiving a printout of a label created in Plant 1)
Plant 3
Plant 4


We have a production that produces a material in Plant 1.

We use a custom FIORI app to scan the products in the machine, when the UL is met a label is printed next to the machine. 

We have 3 machines, 3 printers and one user login in Plant 1.

The print output is printed in each printer depending on the material / machine (correct)

But everytime the label is printed in Plant 1 there is a copy printed in Plant2 (Only in one printer that has no settings in Plant 1) 
This printer has both Host printer and Destination Host setup as the printers IP. (Ours has pr1 as host printer)

PI for each material has correct settings.
Masterdata for each material has correct settings. 


Nothing indicates to a printer in Plant 2, but there is still a copy being printed in Plant 2, everytime a material is produced.

Doesn't matter if i use a different login, it will still print a label in Plant 2, so it doesn't seem to be account related.

The label printed in Plant 1 has both Storage Unit number 3000xxxxx and "internal HU number" 823xxxx" 


Label printed in Plant 2, doesnt have the internal HU number. 





I appreciate all the ideas and help i could get. 


BR 
Sebastian

entry.title: BDC中的BW PCE概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

担心投资多年的BW数仓会被新技术浪潮淘汰？

如果您是企业的IT决策者或数据管理负责人，这些挑战可能正让您夜不能寐：传统SAP BW系统维护越来越复杂，技术人员成本居高不下，而市场上的新数据技术又层出不穷。更让人纠结的是——要么继续承受现有系统的运维压力，要么冒着巨大风险推倒重来。

但现在，有一个解决方案可以让您鱼和熊掌兼得。SAP BDC中的BW PCE正是为解决这一两难困境而生，它将彻底改变您对数据仓库现代化的认知。

 

BDC中的BW PCE是什么？

定义：

BDC中的BW PCE (Private Cloud Edition) 是传统SAP BW系统的私有云托管版本，由SAP完全管理和维护, 是SAP BDC中的核心组件。

产品性质和定位：

这是一个产品，作为SAP BDC的数据仓库层，与SAP Datasphere、SAP Analytics Cloud和SAP Databricks协同工作，形成完整的数据分析生态系统

 

SAP为什么开发BDC中的BW PCE？

客户痛点

本地BW系统维护复杂，技术运维成本高

难以结合新技术，直接切换到新平台可能浪费既有投资

战略层面原因

通过BDC实现SAP数据技术栈的统一整合

帮助客户在保存既有BW投资的前提下采用新技术

功能层面原因

提供SAP管理的数据仓库服务，减少客户运维负担

核心价值主张

保护现有BW投资的同时，实现向现代化数据平台的无缝转型

 

BDC中的BW PCE的核心能力和优势？

功能：

  • 数据产品生成器：自动将BW对象（Info-Provider、Multi-Provider、aDSO、Info Objects）转换为现代数据产品，发布到SAP Datasphere对象存储
  • 提供可扩展性和SAP管理的技术运营升级，支持代码增强和修改
  • 统一数据访问：通过BDC的Catalog功能使所有BW对象可访问，支持Delta共享协议，可实现与SAP Databricks的零拷贝数据共享

主要优势

延长的主流维护支持（BW 7.5 PCE至2030年，BW/4HANA PCE至2040年）

无需立即进行复杂迁移，允许渐进式转型路径

 

BDC中的BW PCE该怎么用呢？

典型应用场景：

  • 数据整合场景：将SAP BW的模型与SAP BDC数据产品在SAP Datasphere中整合，使用现代SQL建模方法统一数据层
  • AI/ML赋能场景：为机器学习和人工智能项目提供坚实的BW数据基础
  • 统一数据平台场景：创建通用数据平台，满足组织内不同的数据消费需求

一次实施过程：

评估和规划：由SAP原厂进行免费的SAP BW云现代化评估，确定迁移范围和策略

系统升级：由服务团队执行迁移（主要是技术迁移）

数据产品配置：激活数据产品生成器，将BW对象自动发布为数据产品，以供BDC其他组件消费

 

总结

BDC中的BW PCE是BDC中的私有云托管数据仓库产品，通过数据产品生成器和SAP管理的基础设施，帮助拥有传统BW系统的企业客户在保护现有投资同时向现代化数据平台转型。

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法

entry.title: Re: Planned Depreciation for Following Month Showing Doub...
entry.content:
For a mid year transfer that contains current year depreciation (7205), the system will check that amount for the current year, if it is under or overstated for the current year then an adjustment will be made in the first period after the transfer date. 

I would suggest create a legacy asset on Q with Manage Legacy Assets app with same details as this legacy asset, post the only the opening values, APC and prior year depreciation, then check the asset depreciation tab in the valuation section of the Manage Legacy Assets app, there you can find what should the depreciation be for the months up until transfer. You can also adjust the depreciation settings and do simulation of recalculation.

entry.title: Setting Up Search for Suppliers in SAP Business Network
entry.content:
Hello everyone, my name is Ashish, and as a product expert for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, I love sharing how you can get the most out of your system. Today, I want to talk about a powerful integration that can fundamentally change how you discover and onboard new suppliers: connecting SAP S/4HANA Cloud with the SAP Business Network.

Are your purchasers spending too much time scouring the internet for new sources of supply? Is it a challenge to vet and verify the capabilities of potential new partners? If so, this integration is for you.

By linking your SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition system directly to the SAP Business Network, you give your purchasing team secure, direct access to a network of more than two million supplier companies. Let's dive into what this means for your business and what the setup journey looks like.

The Power of Connection: Key Features & Benefits

The core purpose of this integration is simple: to make finding and vetting new suppliers faster, easier, and more reliable. Instead of a generic web search, your purchasers get a direct window into a trusted business network, right from their SAP Fiori launchpad.

Here are the standout capabilities this integration unlocks:

  • A Universe of Suppliers at Your Fingertips: Your team can search, filter, and explore profiles on the SAP Business Network. These profiles are rich with detail, describing supplier capabilities, certifications, and even their existing business relationships, offering a level of insight a simple website can't provide.

  • Seamless User Experience with Single Sign-On (SSO): This is the magic that makes it all work smoothly. A purchaser in SAP S/4HANA Cloud can click a tile on their Fiori launchpad and land directly in the SAP Business Network supplier search page without needing to log in again. This frictionless experience encourages adoption and boosts efficiency.

  • From Discovery to Master Data: The process doesn't end with finding a great supplier. Once a promising partner is identified, the purchaser can automatically notify the Master Data Specialist back in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This kicks off your internal process to formally add the new supplier as a vendor, ready for follow-on documents and transactions.

  • Controlled and Secure Access: Even without a full SAP Business Network subscription, your users can perform these searches. Furthermore, you can configure specific roles within the Business Network to ensure your S/4HANA users have permission only to search and discover, maintaining control over your procurement activities.

The Configuration Roadmap: A High-Level Overview

Now that you see the value, you're probably wondering, "How do we set this up?" While the SAP Help Portal has the detailed, step-by-step instructions, I'd like to give you a high-level roadmap of the configuration journey. It involves connecting three key components: your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, your Identity Authentication service (IAS), and your SAP Business Network account.

Phase 1: Laying the Foundation (Prerequisites)

Before you begin, you need to ensure the groundwork is in place.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud: The most important prerequisite is ensuring that scope item 7VL (Supplier Integration) is active in your system. You can check this in the 'Manage Your Solution' app or through SAP Central Business Configuration. If it's not active, you'll need to request its activation.

In SAP Business Network: You'll need a buyer organization and an administrator account. If you don't have access, your Designated Support Contact can help you get set up by logging a service request.

Phase 2: Building the Bridge (Authentication & SSO)

This is the technical heart of the integration, ensuring seamless and secure user access.

  1. Configure in Identity Authentication Service (IAS): First, you'll set up an application for the SAP Business Network within your corporate IAS tenant. This is what enables your S/4HANA Cloud users to be recognized by the Business Network.

  2. Configure on SAP Business Network: This step requires collaboration with SAP. You'll need to gather specific metadata from your IAS tenant (like the certificate and assertion URLs) and provide them to the SAP Business Network operations team via a service request. They will use this information to configure your IAS as a trusted identity provider, enabling the SSO functionality.

Phase 3: Preparing the Destination (SAP Business Network User Setup)

With the trust relationship established, you need to prepare the Business Network to receive your users.

  1. Create a Custom Role: To ensure proper governance, you'll log in to your Business Network buyer account and create a new, restricted role. A good practice is to name it something like "S/4HANA Supplier Search" and grant it only the permission to "Create postings on Ariba Discovery."
  2. Create and Assign a User: You will then create a user (or users) and assign them this newly created, restricted role. This ensures that when your purchasers land in the Business Network, their capabilities are appropriately limited to discovery.

Phase 4: Connecting from Home Base (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Setup)

The final step is to configure the tile in the Fiori launchpad that will take your users to the Business Network.

  1. Create a Communication System: In your S/4HANA Cloud system, you'll use the 'Communication Systems' app to define the SAP Business Network as a known external system.
  2. Create a Communication Arrangement: Using the 'Communication Arrangements' app, you'll create an arrangement for the scenario SAP_COM_0A84 (SAP Business Network – Supplier Search UI Integration). Here, you'll link the Communication System you just created and provide the specific path to the Business Network search UI. This finalizes the connection.

And that's it! By connecting these powerful platforms, you empower your procurement team, streamline supplier discovery, and build a more resilient and diverse supply chain.

As always, for any issues during configuration, you can raise an SAP Support ticket. The SAP Help Portal and SAP Community are your best resources for detailed guides and expert advice.

Happy integrating!

entry.title: Your Central Hub for Bank Statement Processing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Efficient bank statement processing plays a vital role in ensuring accurate cash management and financial reconciliation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Over time, multiple blogs have been published covering various aspects of the process - including configuration, automation, and troubleshooting techniques.

To make it easier for our customers, partners, and consultants to find all relevant resources in one place, this central blog serves as a comprehensive index for all articles related to Bank Statement Processing. It will be updated periodically as new blogs are published, ensuring you always have access to the latest information and best practices.

Featured Blogs

Below are the key blogs you can explore to get a complete understanding of bank statement processing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  1. Overview of Posting Rules in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition : Gain a foundational understanding of how posting rules work and their significance in bank statement processing.
  2. How Automated Processing Rules for Bank Statement works?:  Learn how automated processing rules streamline the interpretation and posting of bank statements.
  3. How to Use Regex in Processing Rules: Discover how regular expressions can be leveraged to enhance pattern matching and improve automation accuracy.
  4. How to Unlock Bank Statement Items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Understand the steps to unlock bank statement items for further analysis or correction.
  5. Renaming of Reprocessing Rules in SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Stay informed about recent updates and terminology changes related to reprocessing rules. GenAI Assisted Content
  6. How to Create a Reprocessing Rule for One-Step Postings of Bank Statement Items: Learn how to configure reprocessing rules that enable direct one-step postings.
  7. Future of Electronic Bank Statement Processing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Release of 4X8: Explore upcoming innovations and enhancements in bank statement processing capabilities.
  8. Structured Format for Field :86: in MT940 Bank Statement: Get insights into structured data handling for MT940 field :86: and its implications for processing logic.
  9. Test Your Custom Bank Statement Definitions in Map Format Data: Learn how to test your custom mappings effectively to ensure seamless data transformation.

Stay Updated

This blog will be regularly updated as new blogs are published in this topic area. You can follow this post to receive notifications whenever new content is added.

If you have any suggestions or topics you’d like to see covered, feel free to share them in the comments below.

entry.title: Re: U.S SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603
entry.content:
Hello @Euna,

You can have a single plan that includes both regular and catch-up contributions. While the regular contribution of this plan can be configured for both post-tax (Roth) and pre-tax contributions simultaneously, the catch-up contribution can only consider one type (pre-tax or post-tax). The wage type configured in the "EE Catch-up contrib." field of view V_T7USBEN03 will determine whether the catch-up plan is selected for pre-tax or post-tax. This behavior has not changed with section 603.

What was modified with the solution delivered to address the legal changes from section 603 is that the system now, depending on your configuration, allows the automatic conversion of catch-up contributions from pre-tax to post-tax. This occurs only if the employee reached the maximum FICA limit in the prior year, as per Note 3617266.

entry.title: The Importance of Primary Finance Settings in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
• This blog is based on version CE2508.
  • The screenshots shown come from an internal SAP test system.

This blog is designed for consultants and customers who are just beginning their journey with SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition). Understanding and correctly configuring the Primary Finance Settings is one of the most critical early steps in an implementation project.

 

Why Primary Finance Settings Matter?

At the start of any SAP Cloud ERP implementation, defining the Primary Finance Settings is a fundamental activity. These settings include:

  • Fiscal Year Variant

  • Group Currency

  • Ledgers and Accounting Principles

These initial configurations form the financial backbone of your system. They directly influence all subsequent financial postings, ledgers, and company codes across your organization. Since they are deeply embedded in the system structure, they must be carefully planned and chosen — because once saved, they cannot be changed.

 

What are the Primary Finance Settings?
The “Specify Primary Finance Settings” activity is a one-time configuration in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC).

Here, you define two crucial values:

  • Fiscal Year Variant (FYV): Determines how your financial year is divided (e.g., calendar or non-calendar year).

  • Group Currency: Ensures consistent and comparable financial reporting across your global entities.

Once these values are saved, they cannot be changed.

The system even displays a clear message:
“Be aware that this is a one-time decision which cannot be changed.” This highlights just how significant these settings are for your overall ERP landscape.

 

How can I configure the Primary Finance Settings?

Step 1: Selecting Ledgers and Accounting Principles

The number and type of ledgers are defined during the initial scoping phase, and — just like the other finance settings — cannot be modified later.

During the Define Scope activity, you’ll select the scope items that determine which ledgers are activated:

  • J58 – Activates the Leading Ledger (0L), assigned to the local GAAP at company code level.

  • 1GA – Activates Ledger 2L, corresponding to IFRS accounting principles.

  • 2VA – Activates Ledger 3L, corresponding to US GAAP accounting principles.

Important:
If you choose to work only with one ledger (0L), IFRS and US GAAP principles and their related content will not be available.

For multi-ledger setups, ensure each ledger is assigned to the correct accounting principle. In this blog, I provided detailed guidance: SAP Recommendation: Assignment of Corporate Accounting Principle to Ledger. 

 

Step 2: Defining the Fiscal Year Variant and Group Currency
Within the Specify Primary Finance Settings activity, you select:

  • Fiscal Year Variant (FYV): Defines your company’s financial reporting structure — for instance, whether your fiscal year aligns with the calendar year or follows a custom pattern.

  • Group Currency: A key value that drives consistent financial consolidation and reporting across all entities and ledgers.

 

 

Where Do These Settings Apply?

The Fiscal Year Variant selected during setup is applied to the Leading Ledger and cannot be changed later.

  • Non-leading Ledgers will inherit this setting, but can be adjusted if necessary.

For a full list of supported fiscal year variants, please refer to the SAP Road Map Viewer> SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) > Explore phase >  accelerator file “Supported Fiscal Year Variant.xlsx”

The Group Currency applies to all ledgers and company codes in the system.

 

What If You Need to Modify These Settings?

If you realize that your initial configuration was incorrect or needs to be changed, the only option is to request a System Reprovisioning.

However, be aware:

This process can delay your project timeline by more than three weeks.

Please find more details:

  • 3401017 - FAQs about S/4HANA Public Cloud System Reprovisioning
  • Getting started with your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Project - Dodging the System Re-Provisioning Bullets 

To conclude:

The Primary Finance Settings define the financial core of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition system.  Because these settings are permanent, always validate your selections carefully before saving. Taking the time to get them right up front will save time on rework and delays later.

 

SAP Help Portal Links:

  • Setting Your Group Currency 
  • Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant 
  • Ledger

 

If you find this information helpful, please remember to give a kudo.

Stay tuned for more tips and insights!

entry.title: Re: How to process a sales order without recognizing reve...
entry.content:
Hello @Meghan4201 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, Sales in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2202.2

Billing Document Types, Event-Based Revenue Recognition

In summary, you can capture the supplier purchase and consumption without recognising revenue by not creating a billing document in public cloud (goods movement only). If you require a formal invoice, you can create a billing document that posts to a non-revenue/clearing GL. This requires account determination configuration in the cloud. I recommend you first validate the no-billing approach in a sandbox and confirm tax/finance acceptance. If an invoice is mandatory, you should implement a non-revenue billing type through the supported cloud configuration path.

Below are steps to validate the billing type (that adheres to the clean-core approach).

Search for Manage Sales Orders à Create the sales order per the normal process.

Save the order.

Create of confirm Delivery/Goods Movement as you require. Use Create Outbound Delivery/Post Goods Issue. Ensure the posting is a goods movement that does not automatically trigger a billing.

Do not execute Create Billing Document for that sales order. By skipping, no revenue invoice will be created and no revenue GL postings will be generated.

If you need accounting offset (internal settlement), post a clearing/settlement document manually or through a follow-up process

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Process complete confirmation all at once
entry.content:
Good day @Lily16 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Dump with MESSAGE_TYPE_X SAPLFKB0 >0 361 >0 428 or >0 361 FKKLOCKS 022, Completing Confirmation,

Community similar cases: Internal session terminated with a runtime error MESSAGE_TYPE_X

To summarise, based on the error translation, the problem seems to be a runtime error due to OData request terminating abnormally. The system tries to recalculate completion data across all items, it finds inconsistent dependencies, and raises an exception in the backend OData component, which then triggers that error.

A workaround could be to confirm your main items separately, do not select all items at once. Just as you have done, select and confirm the external service subitems individually, then, select only the main service bundle item and execute Complete Confirmation. This should prevent the OData aggregation error.

If the issue persists, consider raising a support case with SAP.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

GenAI was use to generate translation content

entry.title: Capitalizing Down Payments Without a Closing Invoice
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am referring to a situation where user need to capitalize an asset under construction before all suppliers have presented their closing invoices.

I was going through the SAP.com and got question on the process which is missing details on how to post.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/67e323b7117e4c91869c258933f47182/353fde531ed3424de10000000a174cb4.html

  1. Down payment

Our case: down payment posted and later settled to AUC using KO88 - it posted TTYpe 180 with down payment amount

  1. Reserves for expected closing invoice

entry.title: Accelerating SAP BTP Integrations with GPT-5: Introducing the SAP Integration AI Assistant
entry.content:
Introduction

AI is transforming how we work. Over the last few years, tools like ChatGPT have evolved from simple chat interfaces to intelligent partners that can understand complex technical problems.

As an SAP Integration professional, I started thinking — what if we could bring that same level of intelligence into the world of SAP BTP Integration Suite?

Having worked with SAP CPI, API Management, and Event Mesh, I’ve often seen teams spending countless hours writing Groovy scripts, debugging mappings, and testing iFlows. These tasks are essential but repetitive — and that’s exactly where AI can help.

This thought led me to create something new: the SAP Integration AI Assistant — an intelligent support tool built using GPT-5, designed specifically for SAP Integration developers and consultants.

 

Challenges in SAP Integrations

Working with SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) can be both rewarding and demanding. Integration developers often face common challenges such as:

  • Debugging and formatting Groovy scripts

  • Managing complex mappings and error handling

  • Designing reusable iFlows that align with SAP standards

  • Searching through documentation for the right solution

While SAP provides excellent documentation, finding exactly what you need under project pressure can take time. AI can make this process faster and smarter — assisting developers with real-time insights.

Meet the SAP Integration AI Assistant

The SAP Integration AI Assistant is built on GPT-5 and trained with integration-specific knowledge. It helps developers solve real project problems efficiently.

Here’s what it can do:

  • Code Support: Generate, clean, and format Groovy/XSLT/JavaScript scripts with consistent structure.
  • Design Guidance: Suggest iFlow layouts, adapter configurations, and error-handling approaches aligned with best practices.
  • Troubleshooting: Analyze error messages or mapping issues and suggest probable fixes.
  • Learning Tool: Act as a companion for those new to SAP Integration Suite, explaining concepts and configurations clearly.

It’s like having a virtual SAP Integration mentor — available anytime you need it.

Built from Real Project Experience

This idea came from years of working on integration projects across global landscapes — building, optimizing, and reviewing iFlows in SAP BTP.

The assistant is designed to share this accumulated experience. It transforms real-world learnings into actionable insights that any developer can use directly in their daily work.

Getting Started

You can begin experimenting with the SAP Integration AI Assistant right away.

Use it to:

  • Generate or optimize Groovy/XSLT code
  • Validate iFlow designs and configurations
  • Troubleshoot mapping or adapter errors
  • Explore integration scenarios with API Management and Event Mesh

 Try it here:  SAP Integration AI Assistant   

 

Sample Examples

 

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend — it’s an everyday tool for developers.
By combining SAP Integration expertise with AI capabilities, we can build integrations faster, reduce manual effort, and improve quality.

 

 

#SAPBTP,#IntegrationSuite,#CPI,#SAPIntegration,#AI,#Automation,#GPT5,#CloudIntegration,#Groovy,#XSLT,#SAPDevelopers, @RameshVaranganti

entry.title: SAP Business AI中的AI Foundation概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

AI革命就在眼前，你的企业准备好了吗？

还在为AI项目无法落地而焦虑？看着竞争对手用AI提效增收，自己却不知从何下手？传统的AI开发门槛高、工具散乱、与业务脱节，让许多企业望而却步。

但如果告诉你，有一个专为企业量身打造的AI"操作系统"，能让你像使用办公软件一样轻松构建AI应用，将AI真正融入业务流程，创造实实在在的价值呢？

SAP AI Foundation正是为解决这些痛点而生——这不仅关乎技术升级，更关乎你的企业能否在AI时代保持竞争优势。

 

SAP AI Foundation是什么？

SAP AI Foundation是SAP的一体化AI工具包，为开发者提供构建、扩展和运行企业级AI解决方案的完整平台。

是一个产品集合概念，作为SAP BTP上的AI操作系统，为SAP Business AI提供基础设施、工具和服务支撑

 

SAP为什么要开发SAP AI Foundation？

企业在AI开发和部署中面临资源需求高、工具分散、缺乏集成以及难以在不同地区和法规下负责任地扩展AI等挑战

战略目的:

通过统一的开发和编排平台，支持SAP的三个核心AI承诺：驱动相关结果、激活可靠洞察、负责任地扩展

功能目的:

简化AI模型上线流程、提供统一工具集成、确保AI在业务环境中的安全合规运行

核心价值主张:

让组织能够安全、高效地大规模构建、扩展和运行定制AI解决方案

 

SAP AI Foundation的核心能力

AI模型的开发，测试，部署: 通过SAP AI Core和SAP AI Launchpad提供完整的AI模型生命周期管理，包括训练、部署和推理服务 ,

生成式AI中心: 提供对大多数顶级LLM的访问和提示词管理工具，支持多模型编排和实验

接入业务数据与上下文: 利用SAP HANA Cloud向量引擎和SAP知识图谱，将AI与业务数据和上下文相结合

 

SAP AI Foundation与市场同类产品的区别

产品功能优势

  • 提供从LLM API到自定义模型开发的完整AI工具链，涵盖文档处理、推荐系统、机器翻译等业务场景
  • 集成多个领先的通用AI供应商和LLM提供商，确保客户跟上创新步伐并具备所需的灵活性

SAP生态协同效应

  • 与SAP应用程序无缝集成,尤其是与S/4HANA内置的ISLM模型管理工具的对接可以帮助S/4HANA快速接入定制化AI能力
  • SAP HANA Cloud向量引擎专为生成式AI用例设计，能够将向量数据与事务、空间、图形和JSON数据结合处理
  • 还能结合SAP预置的专用AI服务例如Document AI，Joule Studio

差异化特色

  • 相比通用AI平台，SAP AI Foundation深度理解业务流程和SAP特定内容，提供业务相关的AI能力
  • 相比其他企业AI解决方案，提供了完整的多租户支持和企业级安全合规能力

 

SAP AI Foundation的使用方式

AI Foundation主要用于定制化AI场景的开发，举例如下：

  • 文档处理自动化: 使用文档信息提取服务处理大量业务文档，自动提取发票、付款单等关键信息
  • 个性化推荐系统: 基于用户浏览历史和物品描述提供高度个性化的推荐，提升用户体验
  • 生成式AI应用开发: 通过生成式AI中心快速开发和部署基于LLM的业务应用

总结

SAP AI Foundation作为企业级AI操作系统，通过统一平台和深度业务集成，让组织能够安全高效地构建和运行真正理解业务的AI解决方案。

entry.title: Re: Getting error when opening excel file using GUI download
entry.content: Maybe you're not aware of what can be an "Excel file". It can be different formats, text (ASC) or binary (BIN). Both can themselves be divided into several subformats: text can be CSV (colon or semicolon depending on countries)), tab-separated fields (suffix .txt), fixed-width columns. Binary files can be the formats XLS, XLSX, etc. Also, you have to understand that the format and the file extension are two different things, but they must match otherwise Excel displays an alert. XLSX is like a ZIP file containing many XML files.

entry.title: Re: Do adding the setup formula to processing unit have a...
entry.content:
https://me.sap.com/notes/2584494/E

Differences between Production order scheduling and Process order scheduling:

  • Production orders are only scheduled one direction based on the indicated scheduling type. Process orders are always scheduling both backwards and forwards.
  • Production orders are scheduled based on operation sequence. Process orders are scheduled on phase relationship.
  • Production order operations have 3 segments: Setup, Processing, Teardown, so 3 formulas can be configured in work center. Process order phases don't have segments, so only 1 formula in resource.

entry.title: Re: workflow approval process
entry.content:
Good day @jerrysam 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions, Extensibility and Integration Concepts

Blog: Empowering business users to create new workflows with S/4HANA Cloud, public edition and SAP BTP - Part 1 (see part 2 & 3 in blog)

Blog: Part 1: Integrating an Extension Workflow on SAP BTP into a Flexible Workflow

In summary, the reason for the error (double approval) is, in public cloud, duplicate approvals occur because both the BTP and S4H flexible workflow are active. The easiest way to prevent this is for you to:  

  • Control the workflow start conditions inside your public cloud tenant.
  • Add a custom flag in the integration payload to identify BTP- originated documents or,
  • Fully centralise approval in BTP and disable the PO workflow in S/4HANA.

I recommend you consider the first two because they follow the public cloud clean core approach

Below is detailed flow on how to control the workflow start conditions inside you public cloud tenant:

Search for Manage Workflow for Purchase Orders

Open your active workflow --> navigate to the start conditions tab. 

Add a new condition that checks the origin or custom field of the Purchase Order. An example could be “Custom Field “Created via BTP Workflow” =True or PR Source System = BTP. Make sure you don’t trigger the PO approval workflow list.

This will ensure your Purchase Orders created from approved PRs in BTP will bypass the S/4HANA approval workflow. 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Como a Reforma Tributária no Brasil Impacta os usuários SAP
entry.content:
A reforma tributária no Brasil é um tema de grande relevância para empresas que precisam se adaptar a estas mudanças legais. Para os usuários SAP, é importante entender como a reforma afeta os processos logísticos e financeiros, estar ciente dos prazos de implantação e saber quais são as soluções providas pela SAP para garantir uma transição tranquila.

Cronograma de Implementação da Reforma

  • 2026: A reforma tributária começa a ser testada, com taxas iniciais mais baixas de 0,9% para a Contribuição sobre Bens e Serviços (CBS) e 0,1% para o Imposto sobre Bens e Serviços (IBS).
  • 2027: A CBS passa a valer, substituindo PIS e Cofins. A alíquota de IPI será zerada, exceto para produtos industrializados na ZFM.
  • 2028: Último ano de ICMS e ISS sem alteração.
  • 2029: Eliminação gradual do ICMS e ISS, com redução anual de 10% em suas taxas, como parte da substituição pelo IBS.
  • 2033: Adoção integral do novo regime tributário, com a extinção de ICMS e ISS.

Entregas da SAP
A SAP está comprometida em apoiar seus clientes durante a transição para o novo modelo tributário. As soluções SAP estão sendo atualizadas para atender aos novos requisitos legais, garantindo que as empresas possam se adequar às mudanças.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
Recomendamos fortemente o uso da ferramenta Note Analyzer para organizar a implementação das SAP Notes desta solução. Consulte a SAP Note 3200109 para obter instruções sobre essa ferramenta e utilize o arquivo XML anexo à SAP Note 3561376 para relacionar as entregas da SAP para a Reforma Tributária do Brasil. A versão mais recente do Note Analyzer introduz um recurso que exibe a ordem de implementação na coluna "comentários" após a importação do XML. Siga esta ordem, mesmo que algumas SAP Notes não sejam relevantes para o seu negócio. Observe que a ferramenta fornece a ordem correta, mas não uma lista completa dos pré-requisitos das SAP Notes. Assim, análises adicionais podem ser necessárias para lidar com possíveis dependências.

Observações importantes durante a implementação das SAP notes
Para cada nota SAP que será implementada, reserve um momento para ler o seu conteúdo em texto. Desta forma, será possível se informar sobre notas pré-requisito conhecidas, passos manuais a serem executados antes ou depois da implementação automática das instruções de correção, assim como ficar ciente de outras instruções. A leitura do conteúdo de cada nota a ser implementada pode evitar problemas de implementação e a necessidade de retrabalho.
Além disso, é muito importante não prosseguir para a implementação de SAP notes subsequentes deixando notas anteriores incorretamente implementadas no sistema (status incompletely implemented), pois isso leva a um sistema corrompido e sem os contextos e objetos necessários para futuras implementações. Portanto, ao implementar uma lista de SAP Notes, assegure-se de que cada nota está sendo implementada corretamente e completamente.

Recursos de Apoio
A SAP disponibiliza vários recursos de apoio, entre eles:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: Permite que clientes e parceiros da SAP compartilhem informações e colaborem em assuntos relacionados à Reforma Tributária. Este espaço tem atualização diária.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note para leitura: Descreve a estratégia de entrega e suporte para a solução de Reforma Tributária do Brasil. Esta nota, de atualização frequente, lista as entregas da solução conforme são liberadas para clientes. Assim, anexado a ela está o arquivo XML sempre atualizado para o uso no Note Analyzer, auxiliando a implementação das SAP Notes na ordem adequada.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ para leitura: Esta SAP Note informativa destaca os processos ainda não suportados pela SAP relacionados à Reforma Tributária no Brasil, especialmente sobre cenários a serem testados com a SEFAZ. Esta nota será atualizada regularmente.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: Além de explicar sobre a entrega da SAP e trazer os links diretos da plataforma Regulatory Change Manager para os assuntos da Reforma Tributária, este KBA de Troubleshooting auxilia a resolver os possíveis problemas já identificados durante a implementação das SAP notes. Ao oferecer soluções para problemas comuns, este KBA é continuamente atualizado para incluir novas informações.

Prazo de Implementação para clientes
Os clientes SAP precisam ter as soluções SAP referentes à reforma tributária totalmente implementadas e testadas até dezembro de 2025, para garantir conformidade com as novas obrigações a partir de janeiro de 2026.

Validação por parte do governo
Atualmente, é possível testar a aprovação de documentos com os campos dos novos tributos em ambiente de homologação da SEFAZ e, de forma facultativa, enviá-los também em produção.
O ambiente produtivo da SEFAZ começará a validar os novos campos de XML da NF-e relacionados aos impostos da reforma tributária a partir de janeiro de 2026. Até essa data, o preenchimento desses novos campos é facultativo e, mesmo que preenchidos, não devem causar rejeição na aprovação da NF-e.
A partir de janeiro de 2026, o preenchimento dos campos dos novos impostos será obrigatório, com valor jurídico, para documentos fiscais eletrônicos em ambiente de produção. A não conformidade poderá levar à rejeição das notas fiscais.

Conclusão
A reforma tributária no Brasil traz uma mudança legal significativa, portanto, esteja atento ao prazo de adequação.
As notas informativas da SAP listadas acima e o KBA de troubleshooting seguirão em constante atualização para que você tenha acesso a informações relevantes enquanto atualiza o seu sistema.
Utilize os recursos disponíveis e interaja no Work Zone para tirar dúvidas.

entry.title: Unlocking the Power of Model Context Protocol (MCP) for SAP Business Applications
entry.content:
What is Model Context Protocol?

In today’s rapidly evolving enterprise landscape, SAP business applications are at the heart of mission-critical operations—from Order to Cash and Procure to Pay, to Financial Reporting and beyond. Yet, many organizations still face persistent challenges: siloed data, fragmented workflows, and manual processes that slow innovation and limit agility.

Model Context Protocol (MCP) represents a breakthrough in how Generative AI—including Large Language Models (LLMs)—can drive real business outcomes within SAP environments. MCP transforms AI from a passive responder into an active agent, capable of planning, orchestrating, and executing complex business tasks across diverse SAP and non-SAP systems

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) enables any functionality to be exposed as AI-accessible tools, allowing models to not only understand a request but also act to fulfil it.

Born from Anthropic’s work on the Claude Code IDE, MCP was designed to seamlessly integrate a wide range of capabilities — from multi-language programming support to CI/CD frameworks and dependency management — directly into the AI’s operational toolkit. Instead of retraining models for every new capability, MCP gives them instant access to the tools they need.

Unlike Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), which focuses on providing extra context to the model, MCP goes further — it provides actionable functionality. When combined, RAG and MCP form a powerful framework: RAG informs the AI with relevant knowledge, while MCP equips it with the means to execute tasks.

This synergy enables AI to plan, select the right tools, and carry out complex operations — paving the way for true agentic applications in enterprise environments. For SAP business applications, MCP is not just an enhancement — it’s the future of how AI will work with systems to drive automation, decision-making, and innovation.

How MCP works?

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) operates on client–server architecture model that transforms Large Language Models (LLMs) from passive responders into active agents capable of executing complex business tasks. On the server side, MCP hosts a library of well-defined tools — each with clear input/output specifications — that can securely access data, run processes, and return results. These servers can run locally for tasks that don’t require cloud services, or be securely hosted to connect with databases, SAP systems, and other enterprise platforms. On the client side, the MCP client acts as the bridge between the LLM and the server: it injects the right context from the user request, discovers available tools via frameworks like LangGraph, and enables the LLM to plan, select, and invoke the appropriate tool. The results are fed back to the LLM, which then produces a polished, context-aware response for the user. By connecting to multiple MCP servers, applications can tap into diverse capabilities across domains — enabling true agentic intelligence where AI autonomously plans, executes, and delivers business outcomes.

Key capabilities of MCP:

 

How is it Applicable to SAP Business Applications

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) has strong applicability to SAP business applications when viewed from both a business and technical perspective.

From a business perspective, SAP applications support complex, end-to-end scenarios across multiple lines of business such as Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Hire to Retire, Materials Planning, and Financial Reporting and many more. Each of these high-level process drills down further into granular Level 2 and Level 3 processes, where specific operational steps occur. On a client landscape, the data for these processes might exist on different SAP or non-SAP systems. This poses a problem to the end-to-end process flows as this data is siloed and difficult to access.

The MCP tools can be designed to align directly with these sub-processes existing on multiple systems, enabling agentic AI clients to interpret a user’s request, extract relevant context using the tools, plan the necessary sequence of actions, and then invoke the right tools to perform operations on SAP systems. This means that tasks which traditionally require manual navigation through multiple SAP transactions can now be automated, orchestrated, and executed intelligently by AI.

 

From a technical perspective, SAP ecosystem offers cloud-native capabilities via SAP BTP and Kyma, which can host and run MCP servers with well-defined tools. An MCP client could, for example, can be implemented as a lightweight Flask application with multiple API routes, each tailored for specific user requests. When a request comes in, the client extracts the context, passes it to the LLM, and the LLM determines the required actions before calling the appropriate MCP server tools. This client application can be deployed on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry and integrated with a CAP application, complete with a user interface — such as BPA forms or interactive UI apps — to give end users a seamless working environment or integrated with Joule Studio

In essence, MCP server and client mechanisms can function as microservices that integrate effortlessly with SAP applications on SAP BTP, enabling:

  • Direct alignment of MCP tools with SAP Level 2 and Level 3 processes.
  • Secure execution of business logic via SAP ODATA services and BTP-hosted MCP servers bringing in data from other Applications into SAP.
  • Context-aware orchestration of actions by LLMs, reducing manual intervention.

By combining SAP’s robust business processes with MCP’s agentic capabilities, enterprises can move toward a future where SAP applications are not only transactional but also intelligent, autonomous, and proactive in delivering business outcomes.

Example implementation

Consider a comprehensive Vendor Onboarding scenario — one that not only creates vendors in the SAP system but also validates their details via multiple external APIs, retrieves information from various sources, identifies missing data, generates a targeted questionnaire, and sends it to the vendor contact for completion.

Traditionally, this process takes several days and involves multiple teams working across different systems to collect, verify, and enter vendor details into SAP. Using Large Language Models (LLMs) combined with MCP servers and tools, this workflow can be transformed into Agentic Automation — where AI autonomously plans and executes the onboarding steps based on the specific vendor’s context. The automation adapts dynamically to each case, using available information and determining what needs to be collected, drastically reducing onboarding time while leveraging existing tools in the customer’s landscape.

In the recent SAP–AWS Hack2Build event, IBM implemented an agentic Sustainability skills using MCP server–client architecture using SAP BTP and AWS joint reference architecture as follows:

  1. API Availability: The necessary Sustainability Tracing APIs were already built and exposed via AWS API Gateway.
  2. MCP Server Setup: An MCP server was created to expose these AWS APIs, making them directly callable by the LLM. Without MCP, the APIs could only be used by other applications or services — not directly by AI agents.
  3. Hosting on SAP BTP: The MCP server was deployed and run on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, ensuring secure and scalable access.
  4. MCP Client Application: A lightweight HTTP-routes-based MCP client was built to handle natural language queries from end users.
    • The client extracts context and parameters from the user request using the LLM.
    • It calls the LLM with the relevant tools and parameters so the AI can decide when to use a tool — and when not to, in case of a generic question.
    • This client was also hosted on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry and connected to the MCP server to list and use tools dynamically based on the request.
  5. CAP Application Integration: A CAP (Cloud Application Programming) application was used as the frontend/UI layer, sending the user’s request to the MCP client and displaying results back to the user.

By simply using the MCP server and client framework hosted on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, we built an end-to-end agentic application. This approach not only integrates external APIs directly into the SAP landscape but also provides a scalable pattern to make existing SAP applications agentic — enabling them to autonomously plan, execute, and adapt workflows.

 

 

Business Value and Benefits

Effective Agentic Automation is becoming one of the most impactful approaches to enterprise process automation, offering strategic and operational advantages across SAP landscapes. Traditionally, automation initiatives have focused on the “happy path” — the ideal scenario where processes execute exactly as planned. However, large organizations experience happy paths only about 40% of the time. The remaining majority are exceptions caused by regional variations, departmental workflows, process differences, compliance requirements, or unforeseen data gaps.

This is exactly where the Model Context Protocol (MCP) integrated with SAP business applications delivers transformative value. Rather than relying on rigid, rule-based flows, MCP enables agentic systems that adapt to context in real time. LLM-powered MCP clients can understand nuanced user requests, identify what information is available, determine what is missing, plan next steps dynamically, and call the right tools to complete the process — whether the scenario follows the happy path or not.

Applied to SAP, this means:

  • End-to-end process automation for complex scenarios like Vendor Onboarding, Order to Cash, or Procure to Pay, without manual form-filling or multiple transaction hops, and integrating external tools within SAP workflows.
  • Adaptive workflows that can continue operating despite ambiguity, incomplete data, or process deviations.
  • Human oversight with reduced workload, where operators monitor progress and guide agents in exceptional cases, rather than executing every step themselves.
  • Integration of external APIs and internal services, bringing together SAP ODATA services, SAP BTP microservices, and third-party tools under a single agentic control layer.

By hosting MCP servers and clients on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, organizations can make existing SAP applications truly agentic — systems that don’t just respond to requests but can plan, decide, and act in pursuit of business goals. The result is a significant reduction in process cycle times, improved operational efficiency, and greater flexibility in handling real-world complexity.

In short, MCP brings the intelligence and adaptability needed to turn SAP into a proactive business partner — one that can automate not just the ideal scenarios, but also the messy, exception-driven realities that dominate enterprise operations.

Things to look out for

While the Model Context Protocol (MCP) offers powerful capabilities to make SAP applications agentic, there are several critical considerations that must be addressed to ensure secure, reliable, and scalable deployments:

  1. Security of Applications – MCP servers and clients can be hosted across different environments, and tools may need to access data from multiple sources. This distributed nature requires end-to-end security planning, including authentication, authorization, encryption, and secure API access. Role propagation across systems is essential so that permissions are consistently enforced throughout the workflow.
  2. Context Engineering – The quality and precision of context passed to the LLM directly determines which tools are invoked and in what sequence. Poorly defined context can lead to incorrect tool calls or inefficient workflows. Each use case may require careful context design and parameter mapping to ensure the LLM receives exactly the right inputs for optimal execution. This often requires iterative refinement during testing and rollout.
  3. Performance & Scalability – MCP-enabled workflows can involve multiple tool calls, external API requests, and data processing steps. In high-volume SAP environments, this can introduce latency if not optimized. It’s important to design for efficient tool execution, minimize unnecessary calls, cache frequently accessed data where appropriate, and ensure the MCP server infrastructure is scalable to handle concurrent requests without impacting business SLAs. Monitoring and load testing should be part of the deployment strategy.

Conclusion

The MCP Server and Client framework has the potential to transform SAP applications into truly agentic systems. By using tools exposed through MCP servers — and seamlessly integrating them with SAP BTP we can have a variety of tools that bring extensive functionality to Generative AI models — enterprises can unlock a new level of intelligent automation. With the ability to reason, plan, and decide the next steps in a process, AI agents can autonomously execute workflows while still operating under human oversight. This ensures that productivity and efficiency gains are not only substantial but also practical and measurable, delivering real business impact.

Why invest in MCP now?

As AI becomes central to enterprise strategy, MCP unlocks the potential for SAP applications to become truly intelligent, autonomous, and proactive partners in business success. By bridging the gap between AI reasoning and enterprise action, MCP empowers leaders to realize tangible ROI, accelerate innovation, and future-proof their SAP investments.

To learn more, do meet us at SAP TechEd, AWS Re:Invent or connect with us via LinkedIn.

entry.title: Re: Master Logistics Series :Outbound Logistics with SAP Logistics Management-Direct LTL Variant
entry.content:
Hi @Bimal_S ,

Thanks for the comment .

This is not an IM Storage location , it is a storage location that is tied to a warehouse .In S/4 ,LGM warehouse is considered as third party decentralized warehouse .

Follow these steps :

  1. Define a storage location under Enterprise Structure >Definition  Materials Management -> Maintain Storage Location.

  2. Define a warehouse number under Enterprise Structure > Definition  Logistics Execution > Define Warehouse Number.

  3. Assign the warehouse number to the storage location under Enterprise Structure  >Assignment  Logistics Execution > Assign Warehouse Number to Plant and Storage Location.

  4. Under Logistics Execution  Integration of External Warehouse Systems  >Activate Decentralized Warehouse System, activate the warehouse as a third-party warehouse by the following settings:

    • Selecting External WMS

    • Choosing SOAP Web Services for Communication External WM

    • Choosing Distribution Immediately at Document Creation for Dist. Mode for the Delivery

entry.title: Content Agent now supports modifiable Transport Request
entry.content:
Overview

With the latest release of SAP Content Agent, you can export the development changes from SAP BTP services such as SAP Integration Suite,  Role Collections etc, to an existing Transport Transport created in SAP Cloud Transport Management Service. You can also choose to create a new Transport Request and select the option to keep it "modifiable". 

This feature would help the users to collect all related changes and iterative changes into single transport request which makes it more manageable to review and process the requests.

Try it out!

  1. Launch the Content Agent UI from your development account by subscribing to the "free" plan and assign the required "Content Agent Export Operator" or "Content Agent Admin" role collection to your user.
    See Subscribe the UI plan and Assign User Roles and Permissions.
  2.  Launch the UI, and navigate to "Content Types" page. Check the status of the content type that you wish to export and if it is inactive, use the automation feature.
    See the details as described here: Automated Integration in SAP Content Agent to enable BTP services for transport 

  3. Navigate to "Export" page and use the wizard steps to select and export content.
    There are two options provided - 
    a)  Choose Create a New Transport Request and select the checkbox Keep this Transport Request modifiable. This would create a new request in Cloud Transport Management using the description source node as provided as inputs in this step. 

     b) Choose Existing Transport Request and use the search option from the list to select the Transport Request ID from the list. This would append the content bundled as MTAR into the existing Transport Request in Cloud Transport Management. 


  4. Complete the next steps in the wizard and check the Activities Performed page for more details.

  5. Navigate to the Cloud Transport Management UI to view the transport Request status. 

     

Summary

Use the feature from Content Agent UI enabling the creation and changes to modifiable transport request towards your SAP Cloud Changes. 
For more details on managing modifiable transport requests, refer to https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/modifiable-transport-requests-now-also-for-your-sap-cloud-changes/ba-p/14194823 .
